S31640-014_syn_1:
Indication: RUL collapse, tumor.
Proc: Flex bronch, mechanical debulking.
Tools: Forceps, Snare.
Findings: 80% obstruction RUL bronchus.
Action: Piecemeal excision.
No thermal modalities.
Result: RUL patent.
S31640-014_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical excision of endobronchial neoplasm.
CLINICAL CONTEXT: Patient with persistent RUL atelectasis.
FINDINGS: A polypoid lesion was visualized occluding the right upper lobe orifice. 
INTERVENTION: Using a therapeutic flexible bronchoscope, the lesion was resected using a combination of biopsy forceps and electrosurgical snare (mechanical cutting). The tumor was removed in piecemeal fashion until the lobar orifice was patent. No vaporizing or coagulating ablation was performed.
S31640-014_syn_3:

- Documentation confirms removal of tissue, not just biopsy.
- No thermal ablation codes (31641) utilized.

S31640-014_syn_8: [REDACTED] a collapsed lung lobe due to a tumor blockage. We performed a flexible bronchoscopy to clear the airway. Upon reaching the right upper lobe, we found the tumor blocking the entrance. We used a snare to loop around the tumor and cut it, and forceps to pull the pieces out. We continued this until the airway was open again. No heat therapy was needed.
S31640-014_syn_9:
Procedure: Flexible endoscopy with physical resection of RUL mass.
Findings: Exophytic growth obstructing the RUL orifice.
Action: The mass was excised using a wire loop and grasping tools. The growth was extracted piecemeal. No thermal destruction was utilized.
Result: The lobar entrance was patent.

Patient: [REDACTED], 59-year-old female
MRN: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Location: [REDACTED]
Attending: Dr. Jason Miller

Indication:
Persistent collapse of right upper lobe due to endobronchial tumor at RUL bronchus.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of RUL tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation (propofol, fentanyl) via LMA. ASA class III.

Findings:
Polypoid tumor at the origin of the RUL bronchus causing 80% obstruction. No other central lesions.

Interventions:
Mechanical debulking performed using forceps and snare resection of the tumor. Tumor removed in piecemeal fashion until the RUL bronchus was widely patent. No thermal techniques (APC, laser, cryotherapy, PDT, or RFA) were used.

Hemostasis:
Minimal; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
10 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Observed post-procedure and discharged home; CT chest ordered in 6 weeks to evaluate re-expansion.
